Bibliography

Beatles, The. 2000. The Beatles Anthology. San Francisco: Chronicle Books.

Berry, Chuck. 1957. “School Day.” Chuck Berry Anthology. MCA.

Bowman, Rob. 1989. To Kingdom Come. Capitol.

Bowman, Rob. 2000. The Band. Capitol.

Bowman, Rob. 2000. Music From Big Pink. Capitol.

Boyd, Joe. 2006. White Bicycles: Making Music in the 1960s. London: Serpent's Tail.

Chandler, Raymond. 1950. “The Simple Art of Murder.” The Simple Art of Murder. New York: Random House.

Costello, Elvis. 22 Mar. 2002. “Transport the Imagination.” USA Weekend. Gannett Co..

Di Perna, Alan. Oct. 2002. “Heart of Stone.” Guitar World. New York: Stanley R. Harris.

Dylan, Bob. 2004. Chronicles, Volume 1. New York: Simon & Schuster.

Dylan, Bob. 4 Oct. 2004. “The Book of Bob.” Newsweek. New York: MSNBC.

Egan, Sean. 35915. “You'll Never Hear Surf Music Again.” Uncut. London: IPC Media.

Fricke, David. 1995. Peel Slowly And See. Polygram Records.

Frost, Robert. 1979. “The Road Not Taken.” Poetry of Robert Frost. Henry Holt.

Furay, Richie, with John Einarson. 1997. For What It's Worth: The Story of Buffalo Springfield. Quarry Press.

Goodman, Fred. 1997. The Mansion on the Hill: Dylan, Young, Geffen, and Springsteen and the Head-on Collision of Rock and Commerce. New York: Crown.

Greenfield, Robert. 25 Jan. 2007. “The Greatest Record Man of All Time.” Rolling Stone. Rolling Stone.

Helm, Levon, with Stephen Davis. 1993. This Wheel's On Fire: Levon Helm and the Story of The Band. New York: William Morrow and Company.

Hibbard, Don J., and Kaleialoha, Carol. 1983. The Role of Rock. Prentice-Hall.

Johnson, Robert. 1996. “Crossroads.” Complete Recordings. Sony/Columbia.

Lennon, John, and Paul McCartney. 1964. “I Don't Want to Spoil the Party.” Beatles For Sale. Emd/Capitol.

Litweiler, John. 1990. The Freedom Principle: Jazz After 1958. New York: Da Capo Press.

MacKenzie, Gordon. 1996. Orbiting the Giant Hairball: A Corporate Fool's Guide to Surviving with Grace. New York: Viking.

Marcus, Greil. 20005, 2006. Like A Rolling Stone: Bob Dylan at the Crossroads. New York: PublicAffairs.

McCartney, Paul. 35554. “Listen to What the Man Says.” TV Guide.

McKeen, William. 2000. Rock And Roll Is Here To Stay. New York: W. W. Norton.

Miller, Henry. 1957. Big Sur and the Oranges of Hieronymus Bosch. New York: New Directions.

Miller, James. 1999. Flowers in the Dustbin: The Rise of Rock and Roll, 1947-1977. New York: Simon & Schuster.

Mitchell, Joni. 1996. “Joni Mitchell - In Her Own Words.” Super Seventies. Super Seventies RockSite.

Moorman, Mark. 2003. Tom Dowd & The Language of Music. Palm Pictures.

Morrison, Sterling. 1980. “Reflections in a Lone Star Beer.” The Velvet Underground Web Page.

Palmer, Robert. 1995. Rock & Roll: An Unruly History. New York: Harmony Books.

Pelecanos, George P. Apr. 2003. “Thunder Road.” Uncut. London: IPC Media.

Reed, Lou. 1970. “Rock and Roll.” Loaded. Polygram.

Robbins, Tom. 2005. Wild Ducks Flying Backwards. New York: Bantam Books.

Robbins, Tom. 2006. “Introduction.” Siddhartha. New York: The Modern Library.

Robertson, Robbie. 15 Apr. 2004. “Bob Dylan.” Rolling Stone.

Rolling Stone. 1972. Rolling Stone.

Sandford, Christopher. 1999. Clapton : Edge of Darkness, Rev. Ed.. New York: Da Capo Press.

Seger, Bob. 1994. Bob Seger: Greatest Hits. Capitol.

Spitz, Bob. 2005. The Beatles: The Biography. Little, Brown and Company.

Springsteen, Bruce. 2004. “Jackson Browne.” Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Induction.

Springsteen, Bruce. 28 Apr. 2003. “Re-Born in the USA.” UpClose. ABC News.

T-T, Chris. Apr. 2003. “Thunder Road.” Uncut. London: IPC Media.

Tamarkin, Jeff. 2003. Got a Revolution! The Turbulent Flight of Jefferson Airplane. Atria Books.

Weinberg, Max, with Robert Santelli. 1984. The Big Beat: Conversations with Rock's Great Drummers. Chicago: Contemporary Books.

Wolfe, Tom. 1965. “The First Tycoon of Teen.” The Kandy-Kolored Tangerine-Flake Streamline Baby. Bantam Doubleday Dell.
